metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE The objective in this study was to analyze candidates' knowledge on the liver transplantation process before and after putting in practice an educational intervention. METHOD A quasi-experimental, one-group pretest-posttest research design was adopted. The final sample included 15 subjects. Research data were collected between January and March 2010 in three phases, which were: pretest, implementation of the educational intervention (two meetings) and posttest. RESULTS The results evidenced significant cognitive gains after the intervention, with improvements in the participants' performance . CONCLUSIONS The research presents evidence that putting in practice a patient education strategy can enhance candidates' knowledge on the liver transplantation process and consequently contribute to a successful treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Educational intervention for liver transplantation candidates.
